title: Dad of 7 Shares Creative Hacks for Parents with Multiple Babies | NowThis
description:
These parenting hacks are real lifesavers, take it from this dad of 7.
¬ª Subscribe to NowThis: http://go.nowth.is/News_Subscribe
¬ª Sign up for our newsletter KnowThis to get the biggest stories of the day delivered straight to your inbox: https://go.nowth.is/KnowThis

Chad and Amy Kempel already had 2 children when they found out that Amy was pregnant with quintuplets.

Before having their 7 children, the Kempels struggled with infertility. They had multiple miscarriages and lost twin boys at 22 weeks. Despite the odds, Amy carried her 5 babies to 27 weeks at which point doctors needed to intervene for medical reasons. The quintuplets were delivered by C-section 3 months early and spent 73 days in the NICU until they were ready to go home.

After the babies made it home safely, Chad and Amy had to figure out how to make it work. Amy chose to stay at home while Chad went to work each morning at 4am. So Chad came up with a variety of creative solutions to help streamline daily activities ‚Äî including a prop feeding system and an end table with highchairs built in.

Chad shares his inventions on his YouTube channel, calling them Quint Hacks ‚Äî see more here: https://www.youtube.com/user/ChadKempel.

#Babies #Parents #FeelGood #Quints #News #NowThis #NowThisNews

title: Teacher Resigns During Kansas School Board Meeting With Powerful Speech | NowThis
description:
'Teaching is like a bad marriage, you never get your needs met, but you stay in it for the kids.' ‚Äî This teacher resigned on the spot during a school board meeting with this impassioned message.
¬ª Subscribe to NowThis: http://go.nowth.is/News_Subscribe

In US news and current events today, teacher Amanda Coffman resigned on the spot during a school board meeting and delivered a powerful message to her former students. 

Coffman is a former teacher at Indian Woods Middle School in Kansas. She says she resigned because she felt ‚Äòsilenced‚Äô when Shawnee Mission School District issued teachers new 3-year contracts. 

Coffman says the contracts don‚Äôt address the concerns or needs that the teachers have fought for in the past.

Listen to Amannda Coffman's fiery resignation speech to the Kansas school board here. Here is how she plans to continue the fight for better education in America.

title: Donald Trump's Guide to American History | NowThis
description:

¬ª Subscribe to NowThis: http://go.nowth.is/News_Subscribe
¬ª Sign up for our newsletter KnowThis to get the biggest stories of the day delivered straight to your inbox: https://go.nowth.is/KnowThis

In US news and current events today, President Donald J. Trump has claimed to be the smartest, most intelligent president in US history, though his knowledge of the country's past leaves somewhat to be desired. From his defense of Andrew Jackson, complete misunderstanding of the Confederacy and why the Confederate Army was fighting in the Civil War history, and numerous other inaccuracies about world history and U.S. history, this President Trump history lesson will no doubt leave you dumber about the state of history. For President Trump, smart is a state of mind, and while many have cast doubts on the President's intelligence, we'll let this Trump history lesson speak for itself.

title: How Do I Pay for College?
description:
Higher education is likely the biggest purchase you‚Äôve made in your life thus far, but it doesn‚Äôt have to be as scary as it feels right now. In this episode, we‚Äôre going over everything you need to know about paying for school and the different options available, including FAFSA, scholarships, grants, work-study, and loans. Take it from Michelle Obama herself, go to the financial aid office and get to know the staff ‚Äî they‚Äôre there to help you understand this process. In this episode, you‚Äôll hear from Emmanuel Moses, Assistant Director of College Guidance and Transition at The Opportunity Network, Wes Moore, CEO of Robin Hood, Eric Waldo, Executive Director of Reach Higher, and Michelle Obama. 

Check out the full learning playlist, A Student‚Äôs Guide to Your First Year of College, for all the tips and tricks you need to succeed freshman year, featuring advice from experts, upperclassmen, and Michelle Obama. A Student‚Äôs Guide to Your First Year of College was produced by NowThis and YouTube Originals in partnership with Reach Higher.

title: Animal Rights Activist Regan Russell Killed at Pig Vigil | NowThis
description:
Activist Regan Russell was killed while trying to call attention to the cruelty of animal agriculture. This is her story.
¬ª Subscribe to NowThis: http://go.nowth.is/News_Subscribe
¬ª Sign up for our newsletter KnowThis to get the biggest stories of the day delivered straight to your inbox: https://go.nowth.is/KnowThis

65-year-old Regan Russell was killed by a pig transport truck in front of Sofina‚Äôs Fearmans slaughterhouse on June 19. She was at a Toronto Pig Save vigil with some other activists giving pigs water on one of the hottest days of the year.

That day, Regan Russell was opposing Ontario‚Äôs 'ag-gag' Bill 156, which had passed two days prior.

Learn more about Regan here: www.JusticeForReganRussell.org.

title: [Trailer] A Student‚Äôs Guide to Your First Year of College
description:
Freshman year of college can be stressful, scary, and overwhelming for students. That's why YouTube Originals and NowThis have teamed up on a learning playlist called ‚ÄúA STUDENT‚ÄôS GUIDE TO YOUR FIRST YEAR OF COLLEGE‚Äù, a 10-episode crash course covering topics ranging from applying for financial aid to finding mentors and living on your own for the first time. 

A Student's Guide to Your First Year of College is created in partnership with Michelle Obama and her Reach Higher initiative, featuring videos from Mrs. Obama, interviews with experts, advice from upperclassmen and the panel at the Beating The Odds Summit including Mrs. Obama, Malcolm Jenkins of the Philadelphia Eagles, and Wes Moore, CEO of Robin Hood.

Full playlist coming to @NowThisNews on September 4, 2019.

In World news and current events today, world leaders from around the globe have condemned President Donald Trump and his response to the peaceful protest happening in front of the White House as a result of the police killing of George Floyd. 

The senseless act has sparked a movement of George Floyd protests and Black Lives Matter protests not just in America, but around the world, but no other leader has responded to the uprising with the same violent rhetoric as President Trump. From Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada to UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson of England, international leaders from Germany to the entire European Union have roundly condemned the violent response of Donald J. Trump and voiced support for Black Lives Matter, the BLM protests, and the fight for racial justice.
